message_1: Suppose f(z) = 2z + i is an analytical function on the complex plane. Find the complex derivative of the function at the point z = 1+i.
message_2:
To find the complex derivative of the function f(z) = 2z + i, we can treat z as a complex variable and differentiate with respect to it. In this case, the function is a simple linear function, so the derivative will be constant throughout the complex plane.

The derivative of f(z) with respect to z is:

f'(z) = d(2z + i)/dz = 2

Now, we can evaluate the derivative at the point z = 1 + i:

f'(1 + i) = 2

So, the complex derivative of the function f(z) = 2z + i at the point z = 1 + i is 2.
